annotations.description: Let's hope the players will show us more in future games as today's one was rather average, without many exciting moments. It was an even match on the whole, with both sides enjoying spells in the ascendancy. Short passing and possession was the style of the home side, while the visiting side tried to hit their opposition on the break.

Anthony Martial (Manchester United) is all over the pitch today. He is full of energy and asking for the ball, while his ability to control the game and to be on the ball is simply fantastic. Every manager wants to have a playmaker like him.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) sends a teasing cross into the area, but David de Gea intercepts the ball.

Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) collects a pass and strikes from about 20 metres out. It's a poor attempt which flies well wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Manchester United.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Chelsea.

Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) controls the ball and sets off to face the goalkeeper, but deep inside the box the ball bounces up on the uneven surface and makes him miss the strike, sending the ball well over the goal. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Manchester United.

The game produced by the players until now hasn't been particularly attractive, but there is still 45 minutes left so let's hope they will come out with renewed vigour and provide better entertainment this half. The home side is in control of this game. The home team are playing possession football, while the away team look to find a weakness in the opposition's defence mainly with their rapid counter attacks.

Hello and welcome to our minute by minute commentary of the upcoming clash. We will try to provide you with as accurate as possible picture of the happenings on the pitch. Have fun.

Let's hope the players will show us more in future games as today's one was rather average, without many exciting moments.
